question: Which of the following languages are included in the Eighth Schedule of the Indian Constitution?
explanation: It includes 22 languages. They are as follows: Assamese, Bengali, Bodo, Dogri, Gujarati, Hindi, kannada, Kashmiri, Konkani, Maithili, Malayalam, Manipuri, Marathi, Nepali, Odia, Punjabi, Sanskrit, Santhali, Sindhi, Tamil, Telugu, Urdu. Of these languages, 14 were initially included in the Constitution.
